claim.claim-text: WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:
1. A kit for use in inducing an immune response in a mammal, the kit comprising:

a first virus that expresses a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 , or a variant thereof, as an antigenic protein and that is formulated to generate an immunity to the protein or variant thereof in the mammal; and

a Maraba MG1 virus encoding a protein comprising an amino acid sequence SEQ ID NO: 1 , or a variant thereof, as an antigenic protein, the Maraba MG1 virus formulated to induce the immune response in the mammal;
the first virus being immunologically distinct from the Maraba MG1 virus.

2. The kit according to claim 1 , wherein the antigenic protein expressed by the first virus and the antigenic protein expressed by the Maraba MG1 virus are identical. 3. The kit according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the first virus, the Maraba MG1 virus, or both, are formulated for administration as isolated viruses.
4. The kit according to any one of claims 1 -3, wherein
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 2;
the first virus is a negative strand RNA virus and includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 2;
the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 2; or
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 2, and
a) the first virus is a negative strand RNA virus and includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 2, or
b) the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 2.
5. The kit according to any one of claims 1-3, wherein
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 3;
the first virus is a negative strand RNA virus and includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 3; or
the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 3; or
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 3, and
a) the first virus is a negative strand RNA virus and includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of
SEQ ID NO: 3, or
b) the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 3.

6. The kit according to any one of claims 1 -3, wherein the protein variant that is expressed by the first virus, the Maraba MG1 virus, or both, includes at least one tumor associated epitope selected from the group consisting of: FLWGPRALV, KVAELVHFL, EGDCAPEEK, KKLLTQHFVQENYLEY, RKVAELVHFLLLKYR, and KKLLTQHFVQENYLEY, and is at least 70% identical to SEQ ID NO: 1.
7. The kit according to claim 6, wherein the variant is at least 80% identical to SEQ ID NO: 1. 8. The kit according to claim 6, wherein the variant is at least 90% identical to SEQ ID NO: 1 .
9. The kit according to claim 6, wherein the variant is at least 95% identical to SEQ ID
NO: 1
10. The kit according to claim 6, wherein the protein variant that is expressed by the first virus, the Maraba MG1 virus, or both, has an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 4.
1 1 . The kit according to claim 6, wherein the protein variant is encoded by a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 5.
12. The kit according to any one of claims 1 -3 and 6-1 1 , wherein the Maraba MG1 virus and the first virus express different variants of the protein that comprises the sequence of
SEQ ID NO: 1.
13. The kit according to claim 12, wherein

the Maraba MG1 virus includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 2 or 3, and the first virus is a negative sense RNA virus and includes a reverse complement and RNA version of SEQ ID NO: 5;

the Maraba MG1 virus includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 5, and the first virus is a negative sense RNA virus and includes a reverse complement and RNA version of SEQ ID NO: 2 or 3;

the Maraba MG1 virus includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 2 or 3, and the first virus is a DNA or RNA virus and includes a sequence which is SEQ ID NO: 5; or

the Maraba MG1 virus includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 5, and the first virus is a DNA or RNA virus and includes a sequence which is SEQ ID NO: 2 or 3.

14. The kit according to claim 12, wherein one of either the Maraba MG1 virus or the first virus are capable of expressing a protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 or 4, and the other of the Maraba MG1 virus and the first virus are capable of expressing a protein that comprises the other sequence.
15. The kit according to any one of claims 1-14, wherein the first virus is an adenovirus.
16. An isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle having a genome that encodes a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 , or a variant thereof.

17. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 16, wherein the variant the protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 has at least one tumor
associated epitope selected from the group consisting of: FLWGPRALV, KVAELVHFL, EGDCAPEEK, KKLLTQHFVQENYLEY, RKVAELVHFLLLKYR, and KKLLTQHFVQENYLEY, and is at least 70% identical to SEQ ID NO: 1. 18. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 17, wherein the variant is at least 80% identical to SEQ ID NO: 1.
19. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 17, wherein the variant is at least 90% identical to SEQ ID NO: 1.
20. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 17, wherein the variant is at least 95% identical to SEQ ID NO: 1.
21. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 16, wherein the variant of the protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 has an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 4.
22. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 16, where the genome includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 2, 3 or 5.

23. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 16, where the genome includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 6. 24. A kit for use in inducing an immune response in a mammal, the kit comprising:

a first virus that expresses a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 7, or a variant thereof, as an antigenic protein and that is formulated to generate an immunity to the protein or variant thereof in the mammal; and

a Maraba MG1 virus encoding a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 7, or a variant thereof, as an antigenic protein, the Maraba MG1 virus formulated to induce the immune response in the mammal;
the first virus being immunologically distinct from the Maraba MG1 virus.
25. The kit according to claim 24, wherein the antigenic protein expressed by the first virus and the antigenic protein expressed by the Maraba MG1 virus are identical.
26. The kit according to claim 24 or 25, wherein the first virus, the Maraba MG1 virus, or both, are formulated for administration as isolated viruses.
27. The kit according to any one of claims 24-26, wherein
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 8;
the first virus is a negative sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 8;
the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 8; or
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 8, and
a) the first virus is a negative sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 8, or
b) the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 8.

28. The kit according to any of of claims 24-26, wherein the protein variant that is expressed by the first virus, the Maraba MG1 virus, or both, includes at least one tumor associated epitope of SEQ ID NO: 7 and is at least 70% identical to SEQ ID NO: 7.
29. The kit according to claim 28, wherein the variant is at least 80% identical to SEQ ID NO: 7. 30. The kit according to claim 28, wherein the variant is at least 90% identical to SEQ ID NO: 7.
31. The kit according to claim 28, wherein the variant is at least 95% identical to SEQ ID NO: 7.

32. The kit according to any one of claims 24-26 and 28-31 , wherein one of either the Maraba MG1 virus or the first virus is capable of expressing a protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 7, and the other of the Maraba MG1 virus and the first virus is capable of expressing a variant of a protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 7.

33. The kit according to any one of claims 24-26 and 28-31 , wherein the Maraba MG1 virus and the first virus are capable of expressing different variants of the protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 7.

34. The kit according to any one of claims 24-33 where the first virus is a lentivirus. 35. An isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle having a genome that encodes encodes a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 7, or a variant thereof.
36. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 35, wherein the genome includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 8.
37. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 35, wherein the genome includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 9.
38. A kit for use in inducing an immune response in a mammal, the kit comprising:
a first virus that expresses a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID
NO: 10, or a variant thereof, as an antigenic protein and that is formulated to generate an immunity to the protein or variant thereof in the mammal; and

a Maraba MG1 virus encoding a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 10, or a variant thereof, as an antigenic protein, the Maraba MG1 virus formulated to induce the immune response in the mammal;
the first virus being immunologically distinct from the Maraba MG1 virus.
39. The kit according to claim 38, wherein the antigenic protein expressed by the first virus and the antigenic protein expressed by the Maraba MG1 virus are identical.
40. The kit according to claim 38 or 39, wherein the first virus, the Maraba MG1 virus, or both, are formulated for administration as isolated viruses.
41. The kit according to any one of claims 38-40, wherein
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 1 ;
the first virus is a negative sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 1 ;
the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 1 ; or
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 1 , and
a) the first virus is a negative sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 1 , or
b) the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 1.

42. The kit according to any of of claims 38-40, wherein the protein variant that is expressed by the first virus, the Maraba MG1 virus, or both, includes at least one tumor associated epitope of SEQ ID NO: 10 and is at least 70% identical to SEQ ID NO: 10.

43. The kit according to claim 42, wherein the variant is at least 80% identical to SEQ ID NO: 10. 44. The kit according to claim 42, wherein the variant is at least 90% identical to SEQ ID NO: 10.
The kit according to claim 42, wherein the variant is at least 95% identical to SEQ ID

46. The kit according to any one of claims 38-40 and 42-45, wherein one of either the Maraba MG1 virus or the first virus is capable of expressing a protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 10, and the other of the Maraba MG1 virus and the first virus is capable of expressing a variant of a protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 10.

47. The kit according to any one of claims 38-40 and 42-45, wherein the Maraba MG1 virus and the first virus are capable of expressing different variants of the protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 10.

48. The kit according to any one of claims 38-47 where the first virus is a lentivirus. 49. An isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle having a genome that encodes encodes a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 10, or a variant thereof.
50. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 49, wherein the genome includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 1 1.
51. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 49, wherein the genome includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 12.
52. A kit for use in inducing an immune response in a mammal, the kit comprising:

a first virus that expresses a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 13, or a variant thereof, as an antigenic protein and that is formulated to generate an immunity to the protein or variant thereof in the mammal; and
a Maraba MG1 virus encoding a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ
ID NO: 13, or a variant thereof, as an antigenic protein, the Maraba MG1 virus formulated to induce the immune response in the mammal;
the first virus being immunologically distinct from the Maraba MG1 virus.

53. The kit according to claim 52, wherein the antigenic protein expressed by the first virus and the antigenic protein expressed by the Maraba MG1 virus are identical. 54. The kit according to claim 52 or 53, wherein the first virus, the Maraba MG1 virus, or both, are formulated for administration as isolated viruses.
55. The kit according to any one of claims 52-54, wherein
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 14;
the first virus is a negative sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 14;
the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 14; or
the Maraba MG1 virus includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 14, and
a) the first virus is a negative sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 14, or
b) the first virus is a DNA virus or a positive sense RNA virus and includes a codon optimized transgene comprising a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 14.

56. The kit according to any of of claims 52-54, wherein the protein variant that is expressed by the first virus, the Maraba MG1 virus, or both, includes at least one tumor associated epitope of SEQ ID NO: 13 and is at least 70% identical to SEQ ID NO: 13.
57. The kit according to claim 56, wherein the variant is at least 80% identical to SEQ ID NO: 13.
58. The kit according to claim 56, wherein the variant is at least 90% identical to SEQ ID NO: 13.
59. The kit according to claim 56, wherein the variant is at least 95% identical to SEQ ID NO: 13.

60. The kit according to any one of claims 52-54 and 56-59, wherein one of either the Maraba MG1 virus or the first virus is capable of expressing a protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 13, and the other of the Maraba MG1 virus and the first virus is capable of expressing a variant of a protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 13.

61. The kit according to any one of claims 52-54 and 56-59, wherein the Maraba MG1 virus and the first virus are capable of expressing different variants of the protein that comprises the sequence of SEQ ID NO: 13.

62. The kit according to any one of claims 52-61 where the first virus is a lentivirus. 63. An isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle having a genome that encodes encodes a protein comprising an amino acid sequence of SEQ ID NO: 13, or a variant thereof.
64. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 63, wherein the genome includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 14.
65. The isolated Maraba MG1 viral particle according to claim 63, wherein the genome includes a reverse complement and RNA version of a nucleotide sequence of SEQ ID NO: 15.
